metadata.title: CVE-2018-11213 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libjpeg 9a. The get_text_gray_row function inrdppm.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (Segmentationfault) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5
libturbojpeg - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg6b: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
libjpeg-turbo package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-0ubuntu5').
libjpeg9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
